content.description:
This route packs most of the difficulty into the very beginning. The start is a very tricky sequence on a bit of slab using small crimps and small footholds you'll have to look carefully for, and a few finger pockets.

Traverse left underneath the overhanging flake, up some easy climbing on dirty rock in the middle, leading to a very enjoyable pumpy finish with good exposure using good (though hollow sounding) jugs.
content.protection: 8 bolts and bolted anchor. Stick clip recommended due to opening sequence's difficulty.
content.location: Third line of bolts from the bottom of the hill, about directly under the highest point in the dome. Under a large broken undercling about 10 meters up.

content.description:
After traversing over a moss-covered slab to get on route, this climb follows a curvy dihedral leading to a series of spectacular stemming moves for the middle part of the climb.

The top is a bit slabby and run-out to the anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts and bolted anchor with rap rings
content.location: Second line of bolts from the bottom of the hill. Look for the lighter-colored dihedral section indented into the wall

content.description: This climb has a bit of everything. The lower two thirds is a slabby mixture featuring a series of interesting mantle moves on various pockets and a few polished slopers and some small footholds you'll have to look carefully for. The final section is a more pumpy vertical section with good holds (though they feel about to break off in places) and a spectacular final move on a good jug.
content.protection:
8 bolts, bolted anchor with chains and mussy hooks

Stick clip is advised: The move between bolts 1 and 2 is fairly balance-intensive with no handholds to speak of. The first bolt is very low and probably won't keep you from decking, only from tumbling down the hill. Stick-clipping the second bolt will make this section a lot less nerve-racking.
content.location: Far right line of bolts, about 30 meters up the hill from the base of the dome.

content.description:
Approach from left edge of the cliff, climb up a ramp to the first bolt. Ascend overhanging face to the arete, on the left edge of the dome. Unfortunately the arete on the left is very smooth so the route is quite crimpy and in places, reach-dependent.

The second crux is an unusual overhanging section/mantle towards the top.
content.protection: 9 bolts and bolted anchor with chains
content.location: First line of bolts you'll see walking up the hill. Follows just inside the ridge leading up to the dome.
